qas.question: What results came from von Neumann's deep analysis of the measurement problem?

answers.text: physical universe could be made subject to the universal wave function

qas.question: What "outside of calculation" variable could initiate collapse in von Neumann's conclusion?
Were von Neumann's conclusions of collapse of entire universe cause accepted widely?

answers.text: Von Neumann–Wigner interpretation never gained acceptance amongst the majority of physicists

context: In a chapter of The Mathematical Foundations of Quantum Mechanics, von Neumann deeply analyzed the so-called measurement problem. He concluded that the entire <a0_0>physical universe could be made subject to the universal wave function<a0_0/>. Since something "outside the calculation" was needed to collapse the wave function, von Neumann concluded that the collapse was caused by the <a1_0>consciousness of the experimenter<a1_0/> (although this view was accepted by Eugene Wigner, the <a2_0>Von Neumann–Wigner interpretation never gained acceptance amongst the majority of physicists<a2_0/>).
